alert.note: Alert for Charles City; James City; Newport News; Surry; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Charles City, York, southern James City, and northeastern Surry Counties, the northern City of Newport News and the City of Williamsburg through 830 PM EDT... At 745 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Claremont, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Williamsburg, Surry, College Of William And Mary, Queens Lake, Gloucester Point, Busch Gardens, Scotland, Rustic, York Terrace, Lee Hall, Carver Gardens, Grove, Kings Point, Jamestown, Fort Eustis, Denbigh, Lackey, Chippokes State Park and Camp Peary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern, southeastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; James City; Newport News; Surry; York
